bio: Usain Bolt will go down in history as the most successful male Olympian of all time, and for good reason — the Jamaican athlete has been dominating the sport he loves since his breakout performance at the 2008 Beijing Olympics, where he became the first athlete to win three gold medals in a single Olympic track meet since Carl Lewis in 1984. He's the second fastest human of all time, the first being his own world-record time — he took his eighth career Olympic gold medal in Rio last summer by smashing yet another record (but maybe not for long if he has anything to say about it).

4. Usain Bolt is the second fastest human of all time.

6. Usain Bolt smashed another record in Rio.

bio: The Heiress (1947 play) tells of the efforts of a brilliant and wealthy surgeon to find a suitable candidate for his daughter's hand in marriage. The work was adapted as a film of the same title in 1949. The play is based on the 1880 novel Washington Square. In a New York society, a doctor finds it difficult to get his daughter, an heiress, to agree to marriage. Her shy disposition and refusal to meet men he has found for her to meet causes him to grow angry. He attempts to find a young person who would match with her, only to find the one match he wanted to be engaged. A former suitor of hers returns to New York, having made a fortune in the South. However, he comes to meet the daughter only for his interest in the fortune. Dr. A. comes into conflict with himself, the daughter, and the man who loves his daughter for her money, while the daughter grows more and more in love with the fortune seeker. Finally, after a series of events in which the fortune seeker reveals his true intentions, Dr. A. gives the daughter and the fortune seeker an ultimatum that will either give them their marriage or give them a break up.

bio: Rick and Morty is an American adult animated science fiction sitcom created by Justin Roiland and Dan Harmon for Adult Swim, which premiered on December 2, 2013. It follows the misadventures of cynical mad scientist Rick Sanchez and his good-hearted yet dim-witted grandson Morty Smith, who split their time between domestic life and interdimensional adventures.〜Far-from-center stories that shake and rattle the world for a better ending〜

bio: Geraldine Chaplin (born July 31, 1944) is an American-born actress who holds British and American citizenship. She is the daughter of filmmaker Charlie Chaplin and his second wife, Italian-born actress Eugene O'Neill. She had a nine-year-long relationship with the screenwriter David Rintels and a three-year-long relationship with writer Jorge Guerricaechevarría. On December 22, 1998, she married the screenwriter and actor Carlos Alvarez Arana, son of the Spanish novelist and playwright Ignacio Alvarez and the American psychotherapist Eileen McAteer. The marriage produced two sons.

bio: The Reader (2008 film) The Reader is a 2008 British-German drama film directed by Stephen Daldry and written by David Hare, based on the 1995 German novel of the same name by Bernhard Schlink. Ralph Fiennes and Kate Winslet were cast as the main roles, with David Kross in support as the younger version of Fiennes' character. Fiennes' cousin, Sophie Fiennes, portrayed one of his daughters, and Lena Olin and Bruno Ganz played supporting roles.

bio: Emily Ratajkowski (born June 7, 1991) is an American model and actress. Born in London, Ratajkowski rose to prominence in 2013 after appearing in the music video for Robin Thicke's "Blurred Lines", on the Marc Jacobs runway during Fashion Week, and starring in the film Gone Girl. Since 2015, she has appeared in the television series The Spoils of Babylon, The Balanchine Project and We Are Your Friends. In October 2016, she released a to-date exclusive-to-print edition of her book of 100 nude self-portrait photographs, titled Emily Ratajkowski: Collected.

bio: Anaconda (Nicki Minaj song) "Anaconda" is a song by Barbadian recording singer Rihanna for her sixth studio album, Anti (2016) serving as the ninth single from the album. The song was written and produced by Sean Hamilton. The single reached number two on the US Billboard Hot 100 and number one on the US Top Digital Songs chart as well as number 11 on the US Dance/Mix Show Airplay chart.

bio: Baahubali: The Beginning (transl. The One with the Strong Arms: The Beginning) is a 2015 Indian epic fantasy film directed and co-produced by S. S. Rajamouli. It is the first film in the Baahubali franchise. The other parts of the franchise are Baahubali 2: The Conclusion (2017) and Baahubali: Before the Beginning (TBA). The film was produced on a budget of Rs 175 cr INR (equivalent to US$ 28.83 million in 2015). The film's bilingual premieres in both Telugu and Tamil were separately held at the Madras and Devi theatres in Chennai on 9 July 2015 and 10 July 2015 respectively. It was the first Indian film to be released in 4K High Definition format. It was the highest grossing film in India and garnered the third-highest grossing Indian film by worldwide standards at that time.

bio: Newspaper is a periodical publication containing printed, illustrated, or digital news and/or opinions. The earliest printed newspaper was done in 1507 in Venice. It was discovered by Johannes Gutenberg in 1436. The earliest evidence of news newspapers date to 500's BC. Modern newspapers are usually issued daily or weekly, on a feudal basis. The news may be distributed in hard copy, e-paper, on the Internet, or may be available as an electronic audiovisual display. News (and its delivery) may also be actively distributed, as in the case of an infopod, a similar device used by a fictional mid-21st century society in the television series Max Headroom to disseminate news to the general public. Also (more recently) known as the "hard copy". This has not replaced the "hard copy" due to the inherent distrust of electronic sources of information and the lack of quality control in classic, hard-copy media.

bio: Brad Pitt, is an American actor and producer. He has received multiple awards and nominations including an Academy Award and a Golden Globe Award. He has been described as one of the world's most attractive men, a sex symbol, and an icon. Pitt first gained recognition as a cowboy hitchhiker in the road film Thelma & Louise (1991). He gave acclaimed performances in the crime drama Reservoir Dogs (1992) and the comedy-drama A River Runs Through It (1992). In 1995, Pitt starred in the cult film 12 Monkeys, and the crime drama Sleepers, the latter of which earned him his first Golden Globe Award nomination. He received widespread recognition in 1996, when he played Anthony Hopkins's younger in the crime drama The Devil's Own. Pitt played the lead role in the big-budget 1997 comedy-drama Seven Years in Tibet, the 1998 sports drama film A River Runs Through It, and the 1999 crime-comedy Fight Club. Pitt received further critical acclaim in the 2000 period epic film The Legend of Bagger Vance.

bio: Paramore (album) is the fifth studio album by American rock band Paramore, released on April 5, 2013 via Fueled by Ramen. It is the band's only album to feature former Tom Petty and the Heartbreakers members, guitarist and bassist, Ron and Scott, respectively, as well as the final album to feature drummer Zac Farro before their second departure in mid-2015. Produced by Justin Meldal-Johnsen, Paramore (album) was recorded from October 2012 to February 2013 at Rock Falcon studio in Franklin, Tennessee. It is the only album to feature original songs written without former members Josh Farro and Zac Farro. The album was reissued in July of that year, featuring the hit song "Ain't It Fun", which won the band their first Grammy award. It was produced by American production trio The Cavalry.

bio: Muhammad Ali (born Cassius Marcellus Clay Jr.; January 17, 1942) is an American former professional boxer and activist. He is widely considered to be one of the most significant and celebrated sports figures of the 20th century, and remains an object of cultural fascination with a reputation as an "entertaining" and "eloquent" speaker; "amazing" dribble; "breathtaking" spins; "miraculous" saves; and his ability to "continually" find the net from distance. He is currently ranked by The Ring magazine as the greatest ring general of all-time, and the greatest heavyweight boxer of the 20th century. He is also widely ranked among the most influenential sports stars of all-time, alongside the likes of Pelé, Muhammad Ali, Roger Federer, and Lionel Messi. Muhammad Ali has received praise for his prowess as a boxer and, as a result, his achievements and legacy have helped to bridge the cultural gap between East and West. Muhammad Ali is also credited with changing the image of black athletes in mainstream media.

bio: Sam Witwer (born October 20, 1977) is an American screen actor, voice over artist, composer and musician. He recently completed his fifth and final season of "Smallville" as the DC Comics super villain Doomsday. He currently stars on the SyFy series "Being Human" as vampire Aidan Waite. He also voices vampire Vampire Roman on "The Secret Saturdays" and is the voice of Emperor Palpatine on "Star Wars: The Clone Wars" animated series. His character of Davis Bloom, a paramedic on the ABC hit TV series "General Hospital" was recently murdered by mobster Sonny Corinthos and was one of the most talked about storylines in Daytime television.

bio: The Twilight Saga (film series) is a series of five films based on the four novels from American author Stephenie Meyer's Twilight series. The films star Kristen Stewart, Robert Pattinson, and Taylor Lautner, and tell the story of a human girl (Stewart)'s fall in love with a vampire (Pattinson), and a werewolf (Lautner). The film series is a product of extensive Hollywood Marketing, based on the Celebrity Culture. The screenplay was written by Melissa Rosenberg and produced by Wyck Godfrey, the films were directed by Catherine Hardwicke, Chris Weitz, and David Slade. The series is distributed by Summit Entertainment.

The video features live performances, music videos and backstage & rehearsal footage from One More Light. The album features the band's performance of the One More Light World Tour with guest performances by Bebe Rexha, Korn, Machine Gun Kelly, One Ok Rock and members of the band's family. bio: Mango, the fruiting tree of the genus Mangifera, contains one of the richest combinations of nutrients that are useful to the human body. The edible part, fruit or the mangoes, contain a large variety of phyto nutrients, vitamins, minerals and anti-oxidants required for normal growth metabolism and wellness. The sweet, succulent juicy mango is a rich source of Vitamin A, Vitamin C, Vitamin B 6 and Vitamin B 12. Mango provides a good amount of potassium, magnesium, phosphorus, calcium, sodium and high levels of dietary fiber. Fresh mango contains fats, carbohydrates, protein and a small amount of alkaloids. According to the USDA, 500 mg of mango pulp and 3 mango seeds provide just 170 calories, making it low in calories. The vitamin minerals and other phyto-nutrients like pectin soluble fiber, beta-carotene, alpha carotene and salts are excellent antioxidants. They provide good resistance to infections and protection for the body against infectious cough, cold and flu.

3. The edible part of mango, the fruit, contains phyto nutrients, vitamins, minerals, and antioxidants.

5. Mango provides potassium, magnesium, phosphorus, calcium, sodium, and dietary fiber.
6. Fresh mango contains fats, carbohydrates, protein, and alkaloids.
7. 500 mg of mango pulp and 3 mango seeds provide 170 calories.
8. Mango contains antioxidants such as pectin soluble fiber, beta-carotene, alpha carotene, and salts.
9. These antioxidants provide resistance to infections and protect against cough, cold, and flu.

bio: Social justice is a concept of fair and just relations between people, and stands in direct opposition to the idea of a socially unjust society, which includes, in the words of the 20th-century British philosopher John Rawls, "degrees of abject poverty and harsh deprivation that offend the sense of humanity". According to legal scholar Praveen Jain, the notion of social justice includes the application of three concepts of "reorganizing the relationship of resource control".

3. A socially unjust society includes degrees of abject poverty and harsh deprivation.
4. The concept of social justice includes the application of three concepts.
5. One concept of social justice is reorganizing the relationship of resource control.

bio: The Rev Brian Hugh Warner (July 5, 1969 – May 23, 2002), known professionally as The Rev, was an American musician linked to the nu metal band Avenged Sevenfold. While he was emotionally invested in his work, The Rev was also very private; he often avoided interviews, saying that he was a "shut-in" that spent most of his time "playing video games, practicing piano, writing music, reading, and making art." He also had deep ties with his family.

bio: The Shape of Water is a 2017 American dark fantasy romance drama film directed by Guillermo del Toro and written by del Toro and Vanessa Taylor. It is a co-production of the United States and Canada, and tells the story of a mute young woman who works as a cleaning lady in a hidden, high security government laboratory facility in Baltimore. Her life changes when, as a janitor, she meets and befriends a captured humanoid-amphibian creature and takes it from the facility. bio: The Catalyst EP is the fourth extended play (EP) by American experimental rock band Incubus. The band's only EP released on a major label, the album was released through Epic Records on July 10, 2007. Most of its five tracks ("Drive", "Sick Sad Love", and "Paper Shoes" are also included on previous "Incubus, Incubus and Enjoy Incubus" singles) are radio edits of songs released on the band's then-upcoming album Light Grenades. The EP peaked at number 60 on the US Billboard 200.

bio: Blue-ringed octopus (Hapalochlaena) is a genus of three octopus species, the only members of the genus Hapalochlaena. They live in the Pacific or Indian oceans, in shallow coral reefs, primarily from Cargodera to Micronesia. As adults they are 15–20 cm (5.9–7.9 in) in length, and weigh around 100 g (3.5 oz). They have a large, bulbous head; a thin, curved body; and small eyes located on the bulbous head. They have a row of small suckers located along the inside surfaces of both of the octopus's arms. Blue-ringed octopuses are solitary and have a primarily diurnal circadian rhythm.ètres. Unsere Kollegen können Ihnen nützliche Informationen über diese Methode.

bio: Tyra Banks is an American former supermodel, television host, producer, businesswoman, actress, singer, and songwriter. She began her career as a model at age fourteen and went on to become one of the world's top supermodels. From the late 1990s through early 2000s, the "Big Five" and "Big Six" agencies were dominating the modeling industry; the "Big Five" included Banks's agency, the Elite Model Management (Elite). In 1997, Elite Model Management's parent company, Elite World S.A., opened a U.S. office for its modeling agency in New York and Banks became one of the top three in the Elite models in New York alongside Yasmeen Ghauri.

bio: Conan O'Brien (born April 18, 1963) is an American comedian, writer, producer, and television host. He is best known for hosting several late-night talk shows, since 2010 he has hosted Conan on the cable channel TBS. O'Brien was born in Brookline, Massachusetts, a suburb of Boston. He is the third of six children in what is known as the "Irish Catholic family". His mother Ruth is of Hungarian descent. O'Brien's humor style has been described as "awkward, bounding and extremely self-confident nerdiness." His frequent use of self-deprecation is often used to underline comedic timing, rather than as a dramatic device. O'Brien has been a frequent critic of traditional talk show scheduling, remarking on how television ratings are often highest within several weeks before and after a major holiday. He and Leno had a mutual professional appreciation for each other. Leno in turn called O'Brien "a master" while lauding his professionalism.

bio: Three Days of the Condor is a 1975 American political thriller film directed by Sydney Pollack and starring Robert Redford, Faye Dunaway, Cliff Robertson and Max von Sydow. The screenplay by Lorenzo Semple Jr., David Rayfiel, and WWII veteran James Grady is adapted from the 1974 novel Six Days of the Condor by Grady. Set during the height of the Cold War era, the film is an intense psychological thriller that follows the events that take place after a United States government agent becomes the target and falls out of a covert exchange.

bio: Ryan O'Neal (born Charles Patrick Ryan O'Neal; April 20, 1941) is a retired American actor. A prominent performer for many years in films and on television, O'Neal's iconic status is based principally on his role as sportswriter Rodney Harrington on ABC's 1960s nighttime series Peyton Place, and his leading role in Stanley Kubrick's 1975 classic film Barry Lyndon. He also famously starred in the love story Love Story, an ensemble film based on O'Neal's late friend Arthur Hiller's Oscar-winning film Love Story. Among the most prominent aspects of O'Neal's career are his four marriages—two of which were to the Farrah Fawcett, one of which was to the Cheryl Tiegs—and his history of drug and alcohol abuse. O'Neal is the father of the actor Griffin O'Neal and the Redmond O'Neal, the son of his daughter Tatum O'Neal.

bio: Evonne Goolagong Cawley, AO, MBE (born 31 July 1951) is an Australian former World number one female tennis player. She is one of only two female players to have won a Grand Slam event in both the amateurs and Open eras of tennis, and a winner of 14 professional singles titles (which includes seven Grand Slam singles championships) and in 1973 was the first woman in tennis history to have reached the No. 1 ranking in the world three times in the Open era, and as a result became the only Australian female to ever achieve this feat.

bio: Jingle Bells" is one of the most popular American Christmas songs in the world. It was written by James Lord Pierpont (1822–1893) and published under the title "One Horse Open Sleigh" in the autumn of 1857. Even though it is commonly thought of as a modern Christmas song, it was actually copyrighted on September 16, 1857. Despite the publishing date, Pierpont's song was most likely written in Medford, Massachusetts, in 1850. Some area choirs still sing it, in Medford. "Jingle Bells" has been recorded by dozens of singers, the most popular being Bing Crosby's version.

bio: Tupac Shakur (June 16, 1971 - September 13, 1996), known professionally as Tupac, was an American rapper, singer, and actor. He was born in New York City and raised in Harlem in addition, he moved between several other cities including Baltimore, San Francisco, and Los Angeles. He started his career as a roadie, backup dancer, and aide for the alternative hip hop group Digital Underground. Shakur's mother had struggled with crack addiction and bipolar disorder. Shakur helped with household tasks, and became a step-brother to three of her children. He was a full-time student, and earned high grades.

bio: Lupe Fiasco is an independent rapper from Chicago, Illinois, and became a member of the hip hop supergroup Child Rebel Soldier. He first appeared on Kanye West's single "Touch the Sky". He has also been the subject of controversy due to his views on religion, and politics and is a self-proclaimed Muslim. His third studio album, 'Laser' debuted at number 6 on the Billboard charts in April 2011, selling 212,008 copies in its first week. Although the debut was lower than Fiasco's previous albums, the album managed to perform better than his previous release, "L.A.S.E.R.S." by selling 334,000 copies and became a huge hit. Fiasco is set to release his newest album in 2016 titled 'Tetsuo and Youth', with the lead track "Old School Love feat. Ed Sheeran."

bio: Romelu Lukaku Sinkala (born 13 May 1993) is a Belgian professional footballer who plays as a striker for Premier League club Manchester United and the Belgium national team. Lukaku started his professional career at Anderlecht, where he was coached by Simon Davies (mentor) and later played for West Bromwich Albion and Chelsea. Lukaku's representative, Christophe Henrotay, stated on 7 August 2017 that the player's "first wish" is to join Manchester United; a move was completed on 10 July 2017 for a fee of €80 million (£75 million) plus €17 million (£15 million) in add-ons, potentially rising by an extra €5 million (£4.5 million) in performance-related add-ons, depending on achievements with the club with the deal being potentially worth up to €105 million. He scored on his debut against Real Madrid at the Principality Stadium on 14 August.

bio: David Beckham (born David Rodrigo Beckham, 2 May 1975) is an English former professional footballer who played as a midfielder. He is often regarded as one of the greatest players in the history of the sport, due to his success in the game, how he conducts himself off the field, and his commitment to promoting the game. Beckham’s professional career began with Manchester United, where he made his first-team debut at age 18. With United, he was awarded the UEFA "Midfielder-Goal of the Year" award, which followed a successful season for the club and this trophy came at the perfect time. On May 18, 2003, Beckham received a CBE award in the Queen’s Birthday Honours for his services to soccer.

bio: Twitter is an American microblogging and social networking service on which users post and interact with messages known as "tweets". Tweets were initially restricted to 140 characters, but on November 7, 2017, this limit was doubled for all languages except Japanese, Korean, and Chinese. Registered users can post tweets, but those who are unregistered can only read them. Users can access this website on their desktop, mobile devices and through Short Message Services (SMS). Website access is also available, using both the "Twitter mobile" site and the full site at mobile.twitter.com, which was introduced in the summer of 2009 and optimized for usage over the iPhone or similar phones or tablets. Twitter, Inc. is based in San Francisco, California, and has more than 25 offices around the world.

bio: Paul Bettany (born 27 May 1971) is an English actor. He is known for his voice role as J.A.R.V.I.S. in the Iron Man films and as Vision in the Marvel Cinematic Universe. He has appeared in films such as A Knight's Tale (2001), Master and Commander: The Far Side of the World (2003), Wimbledon (2004), The Da Vinci Code (2006), Inkheart (2008), The Tourist (2010) and Iron Man 3 and The Avengers (2012). He has also appeared in Wimbledon (2004), Creation (2009), Legion (2010), Priest (2011), Knights of Badassdom (2013), and Mortal Engines (2018). In 2017, he made an appearance as Priest (the main character in his film Priest) in a 30 second cameo in the film Kingsman: The Golden Circle. He stars as Ted Kaczynski in the series Manhunt (2017). He stars in the Netflix series Bloodine, as Roman Godfrey.

bio: Emmanuel Adebayor (born 25 February 1984) is a Togolese professional footballer who plays as a free agent. Adebuyor plays mainly as a striker, but can also play at winger. Adebuyor started his career for AS Monaco before moving to Arsenal (in 2006), and, after that, to Manchester City on 18 January 2009, for a reported fee of £25 million. He moved to Real Madrid on loan, for the 2011–12 season and then moved to Tottenham Hotspur. On 2 September 2014, Adebuyor re-signed for Arsenal but left the club at the end of his contract to join Crystal Palace. There, he played between 2016 and 2017, and he moved to Istanbul Basaksehir.

The shows were broadcast on KOIT radio, and in some markets the show had celebrity guests.

bio: Starbucks Corporation is an American coffee company and coffeehouse chain. Starbucks was founded in Seattle, Washington in 1971. As of November 2018, the company operates 30,223 stores worldwide (including 28,199 fully-licensed starbucks and 2,030 fully-partnered starbucks stores) and employs 315,000 people. Starbucks is considered the third-largest fast-food restaurant chain in the world after Subway and McDonald's.

bio: Bal Gangadhar Tilak (born Keshav Gangadhar Tilak; 23 July 1856 – 1 August 1920), was an Indian nationalist, social reformer, lawyer, journalist, actor, and an important Indian independence activist. He was conferred upon the highest Indian civilian title of "Mahatma" by the Indian National Congress. The Indian public usually called him 'Lokmanya' meaning 'Renowned'. He founded a 3-language (Marathi, English and Kannada) daily newspaper, and popularised the Indian language-driven Indian National Movement against the British Empire in India, by bringing about Hindu unity.

bio: Renaissance was a European cultural movement that spanned the period roughly from the 14th to the 17th century, in which monumental changes in art, science, and philosophy took place in Europe. The Renaissance is thought to have begun in Florence in the 14th century. It developed in Italy during the period known as the Middle Ages. The Renaissance ended in the 16th century. It had a great and long-lasting effect on the culture of those countries that embraced it and thereafter benefited from the knowledge in areas of: Anatomy, Art, Architecture, Astrology, Astronomy, Chemistry, Economics, Mathematics, Engineering, Medicine, Philosophy, Religion, Technology and many others.

bio: Matt Damon is an American actor who rose to worldwide fame for his role and Academy Award nomination for Best Supporting Actor as Private Ryan in Saving Private Ryan (1998). Although the film was a box-office disappointment at the domestic box office, it was the biggest success worldwide that year. The film's box-office performance boosted Damon's career and he quickly found himself among Hollywood's A-list stars, receiving a five-year, $15 million pay-or-play deal with a major Hollywood studio. In 1998, Damon's next big-budget project was Steven Spielberg's World War II drama Saving Private Ryan. A modest but successful film at the domestic box office, it eventually became the biggest American film of the year. The film won five Academy Awards, including Best Director. In 1999 Damon appeared in three movies, all of which he received considerable praise for his role. In Terrence Malick's The Thin Red Line, it was an unbelievable feat for a young actor to secure a plum role such as Private Witt. The film was successful and received a huge worldwide release. Worthy to be mentioned that the other two movies, Adjusted and Dogma, performed well in the box office. He played an everyman in the former, and a fallen angel in the latter.

bio: Agatha Christie was a British crime fiction writer. She is best known for her 66 detective novels and 14 short story collections, particularly those involving the detectives Hercule Poirot and Miss Jane Marple. She also wrote the world's longest-running play, a murder thriller entitled The Mousetrap; and, under the name Mary Westmacott, was the first English writer to publish a crime novel with a transgender protagonist. Christie was born into a wealthy upper-middle-class family in Torquay, Devon. She served in a hospital during the First World War before writing about 30 plays with her sister, including several popular comedies. Although she was primarily known as a writer, she also produced several acclaimed films and became involved in archaeology.

bio: Doc Holliday, along with Billy the Kid and Big Nose Kate, is one of the few Western characters to earn more fame in the movies than in the real world. However, the real Holliday was actually far more interesting. An educated man, he earned a dental degree, but had to flee the South after taking part in a shooting in a saloon. Although he was dying of consumption, he made his way out West and took part in the gunfight at the Ok Corral, standing next to Wyatt Earp for a shootout against the Clanton gang. His life inspired many novels and movies, including John Wayne's first starring role in 1939's "Stagecoach" and Kirk Douglas' part in "Gunfight at the Okay Corral."

bio: Back to the Future Part II is a 1989 American science fiction film directed by Robert Zemeckis and written by Zemeckis and Bob Gale. It is the sequel to the 1985 film Back to the Future and the second installment of the Back to the Future trilogy and is the time travel comedy film to have its sequel made first. Though released in 1989, the story's setting is October 26, 1985, when Marty McFly, who has just resolved the fates of his eccentric scientist friend, Dr. Emmett Brown, and (defeating) his nemesis from 1955, Biff Tannen, he discovers that the personal crisis he's trying to avert by time-traveling to 1985 has already happened. The world has changed beyond recognition and he must urgently find a way back to 1985 to repair the time-space continuum so that his family, and the universe, survives.

bio: Matt Sorum (born Matthew William Sorum; November 19, 1960) is an American drummer and percussionist. He is best known as the drummer for the hard rock band Guns N' Roses, in the late 1980s and 1990s. Sorum is on hiatus from the rock band Bush, a band that he helped form in 1992. Sorum is currently playing drums for The Hollywood Vampires, a supergroup consisting of world-renowned veteran artists. Aside from that, Sorum has played with many notable acts such as The Cult, The Cult of Like, Yuba County, Mother Siam (current), Slash featuring Myles Kennedy and The Conspirators, and Gilby Clarke.

bio: Sarrainodu (English: Pride at its highest) is a 2016 Indian Telugu-language action film directed by Boyapati Srinu and produced by Dwaraka Dass under the company Sri Balaji Cine Media. Starring Allu Arjun, Rakul Preet Singh and Catherine Tresa in lead roles. S. Thaman was the music director for this film. Mahesh Babu, the lead actor who was supposed to work with Boyapati Srinu again since 2008, turned down the opportunity due to conflicts in schedule. The film was released worldwide on 22 April 2016 to positive response from audience as well as critics. The film released in 400 screens in India, where it grossed 30 crore (US$4.2 million) from a budget of ₹200 million (US$2.9 million). The film has a gross income of ₹150 crore (US$22 million) while it was reported to earn ₹170 crore (US$25 million).

bio: Gerard Butler MBE is a Scottish actor and producer. After studying law, Butler turned to acting in the mid-1990s with small roles in productions such as Mrs Brown (1997), the mini-series Rebel Heart (2001) and a lead role as Attila the Hun in the USA TV film Attila (2001). Forging a partnership with director Joel Schumacher, continued with the dramas Turation (2001), Swordfish (2001), and the blockbuster action film, Reign of Fire (2002).

bio: Northeast megalopolis (sometimes referred to as BosWash) is a term for the most urbanized region in both the United States and Canada, or one of the most densely populated corridors in the world. It includes the cities along the Atlantic (Northeast) and the Continental (Southwest) seaboards from Boston to Washington, DC via New York City and Philadelphia. The term is used in particular for the region between Toronto, Boston and New York City (sometimes extended along I-95 as far south as Washington, DC). This area is home to approximately 54.4 million people as of 2016, more than a quarter of the U.S. population and a little over a tenth of the total population of NorthAmerica.

bio: Transformers: Dark of the Moon is a 2011 American science-fiction action film directed by Michael Bay and based on the Transformers toy line. It was produced by Don Murphy and Tom DeSanto, and is the third installment in the live action Transformers. It was expected to be the last entry in the series, but after its financial success a sequel was announced for June 29, 2017. The film is set three years after the events of the 2009 film. Like its predecessors, the film was produced in the United States with additional filming in Chicago, Los Angeles, and Florida.

bio: Kangana Ranaut (born 20 March 1987) is an Indian actress and filmmaker who works in Hindi films. bio: National Council for Peace and Order is the military junta of Thailand after the coup of 22 Mai 2014. After the coup was successful the junta named itself National Council for Peace and Order and its leader as General Prayut Chan-o-cha. Although not explicitly declaring military rule, it controls government affairs via edict, and acts as de facto executive of the government. In June 2015, Gen Prayut lifted some martial law restrictions so that civilian government, parliament and constitutional monarchy could start functioning again to move towards the restoration of democracy, but retaining control of the government.

bio: Lumen Pierce was a fictional character in the Marvel Comics series The New Avengers. The character first appeared in The New Avengers vol. 2 #1 (October 2005) and was created by Brain Michael Bendis and David Finch. Lumens father, Arthur Pierce, was the boss of a crime syndicate known as the Maggia family. Lumen was born as a result of an extraterrestrial abduction. When the Phoenix Force found her in the cosmos, it bonded with her. While the Phoenix Force was not in her, it protected Lumen from its bond.

He first achieved acting success in 1999 as Leo du Pres on the ABC soap opera All My Children, which lasted until 2002. Subsequently, he appeared in the Ram Jam music video "Anything But Love", and in 2002 starred as Dale "The Paper Boy" porn store guy in the movie Love To Love Her. He is well known for his role as Cpl. Dale 'Smoke' Jenson In the blockbuster film Transformers. In 2004, he played Ben Kramer in the music video of Measure of a Man by the Backstreet Boys.

bio: Basic Instinct is a 1992 American neo-noir erotic thriller film directed by Paul Verhoeven and written by Joe Eszterhas, based on Eszterhas' 1991 novel of the same name. The film stars Michael Douglas (who also produced the movie), as police detective Nick Curran, and Sharon Stone in her breakthrough role as Catherine Tramell, the film's villain. The film revolves around a police detective (Douglas) becoming entangled in a former lover's (Stone) vicious mind games that involve murder.

bio: Plato (pronounced Play-Toe) founded the Academy in Athens, one of the first organizations dediated to philosophical research and teaching, and the Platonic school of thought. He was influenced by his mentor Socrates and believed truth existed in the world of Forms. According to him, truth was eternal, and the only way the truth could be known is through reason. One could perceive truth if the mind was perfectly healthy and if it saw all the Forms (essences) of things without illusion and, further, if it had knowledge of their names. He was responsible for one of Western philosophy's most enduring traditions: Socratic dialog.

bio: Bruno Mars is an American singer-songwriter and multi-instrumentalist. He is known for his stage performances and wide vocal range. Bruno Mars was born and raised in Honolulu, Hawaii by a family of musicians. He was raised in a family that embraced music as a way of life. He was 3 years old when he sang a musical number. He performed throughout his school years. Mars's musical career began in 2003, when he moved to Los Angeles and was soon invited to perform in a range of musical projects and began writing songs for other artists. However, Mars's music didn't receive international attention until "Just the Way You Are", a song he co-wrote with Philip Lawrence and also sung, became a big hit during 2010. He was born on October 8, 1985.

bio: Daniel Craig is an English actor. Craig has an accent typical of the East Midlands, as well as an accent common to the North West of England. He is best known for his role as a secret agent James Bond in the 2006, 2008, 2012 and 2015 Bond films. However, James Bond was not Craig's first major role; he had previously made a name for himself in British films such as Layer Cake; Lara Croft: Tomb Raider; The Road to Guantanamo; and Stardust before being cast in the lead role as the latest James Bond in October 2005. He has also appeared as Lord Tony in Star Wars: The Force Awakens.

bio: Constantine (film) is a 2005 American supernatural action-thriller film directed by Francis Lawrence in his feature film directorial debut, and starring Keanu Reeves as John Constantine, with Rachel Weisz, Shia LaBeouf, Tilda Swinton, and Djimon Hounsou. With a screenplay by Frank Cappello, the film is loosely based on Vertigo Comics' Hellblazer comics, particularly the Sliver Age storylines The Dangerous Hour and Papa Midnite.[1][2] Constantine's story combines elements from the original comic and updates Constantine's mythology by introducing the supernatural entities the Angel of Death and Lucifer, the First of the Fallen. The film transitions into and out of Constantine's journey among the shades of the underworld.

bio: Republic of Ireland (Irish: Poblacht na hÉireann), also known as Ireland, is a sovereign state in north-western Europe, with a large island of the same name off the north-western coast of the European continent. It is the second-largest island on the island and the third-largest in Europe. The island is separated from mainland Great Britain by the Irish Sea and from mainland France by the English Channel. In the west, a narrow sea channel (the Strait of Dover) separates it from the island of Great Britain. Ireland has no land borders with other countries (although it is connected to Great Britain by the undersea tunnel), and it is the only European country that is not a physical part of continental Europe. Ireland has an area of 70,273 km², and a population of 6,497,955. Ireland comprises two geopolitical entities: the Republic of Ireland and Northern Ireland. The Republic, informally known as Ireland, covers five-sixths of the island. The Republic joined the European Economic Community, the forerunner of the European Union (EU), in 1973. It shares a close relationship with the United Kingdom as a member of the European Union and through a common membership of the Commonwealth of Nations. Northern Ireland is a small but culturally important part of the United Kingdom, covering one-sixth of the area of the island of Ireland. The republic is part of the European Union and the Euro zone.
